intro: Eucalyptus conferruminata subsp. conferruminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallees, is a species of eucalyptus native to western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, often multi-stemmed growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically grey-green in color. The flowers are usually arranged in clusters and are typically white or pale yellow, attracting a variety of pollinators. This subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and resilience. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various native fauna.
